definition: to scrape the meat from bones/to pick (teeth etc)/to weed out

sentences.english: It is considered rude to pick your teeth in front of others.
sentences.chinese: 当着他人的面剔牙是很不礼貌的。

sentences.english: NO08, Did you floss your teeth?
You pick your teeth at the dinner table (but you cover your mouth).
sentences.chinese: 你会在餐桌上剔牙，但用手遮着嘴。

sentences.english: The apples are ready to pick .
I have to scale my teeth after dinner everyday.
sentences.chinese: 我每天晚饭后都得剔牙。

sentences.english: The ADA also recommends flossing at least once daily.
sentences.chinese: 他们也建议每天用洁牙线剔牙至少一次。

sentences.english: Don't blow your nose or use a toothpick at the table.
sentences.chinese: 不要擤鼻涕或用牙签剔牙。

sentences.english: It really irritates me the way he slurps his food and picks his teeth.
sentences.chinese: 他吃饭出声和剔牙的样子真叫我不舒服。

sentences.english: Don't blow your nose or use the tooth pick at table.
sentences.chinese: 不要擤鼻涕或用牙签剔牙。

sentences.english: It is considered rude to pick between your teeth where others can see you.
sentences.chinese: 当着他人的面剔牙是很不礼貌的。

sentences.english: It is a bad form to pick one's teeth in public.
sentences.chinese: 在公众前剔牙是一种不良习惯。

sentences.english: It really irritates me the way he slurps his food and picks his teeth in front of others.
sentences.chinese: 他大声的咀嚼，并在别人面前剔牙，这真叫我不舒服。

definition: to scratch one's foot/(fig.) to be stingy/(slang) (of a celebrity) to twiddle one's thumbs (i.e. not release any new material etc)
to hold with one's mouth (as a smoker with a cigarette or a dog with a bone)
